meanings.sent1: The selfed flower bloomed beautifully in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The selfed plant grew strong and healthy.
meanings.sent3: The selfed sunflower decided it was too good for cross-pollination.
meanings.sent4: The selfed tree stood proudly, embracing its unique genetics.
meanings.sent5: The selfed crop produced seeds that were true to its own characteristics.

meanings.definition: To fertilize (a plant) with its own pollen.
meanings.sent1: She selfed the tomato plant to ensure purebred offspring.
meanings.sent2: The botanist selfed the flower for a controlled breeding experiment.
meanings.sent3: The gardener selfed the roses, playing matchmaker with pollen.
meanings.sent4: He selfed the orchids, carefully transferring pollen from one to another.
meanings.sent5: They selfed the corn plants to maintain specific genetic traits.

meanings.sent1: The selfed of the plant led to a high rate of seed production.
meanings.sent2: The selfed resulted in a new generation of plants with similar traits.
meanings.sent3: The garden's selfed was a topic of fascination among botanists.
meanings.sent4: The selfed of the crop was a natural occurrence in the isolated field.
meanings.sent5: The selfed in the greenhouse created a self-sustaining ecosystem.
